examples: The factory employee was eating lunc in the cafeteria.
so I ate my fill.
I eat pizza on Wednesdays.
I ate a delicious apple for a healthy snack.
I ate a handful of sweet grapes for a refreshing snack.
words.defineEn: to put food into the mouth, then chew and swallow it
words.defineVi: để đưa thức ăn vào miệng, sau đó nhai và nuốt nó

examples: The superintendent believed Lancaster's story.
I believed his lies for years.
Scientists believe that a major breakthrough is on the horizon.
Many sports pundits believe the vultures are circling for the team's beleaguered head coach.
His opponents believe he is definitely on the run.
words.defineEn: to accept something to be true even without proof
words.defineVi: để chấp nhận một cái gì đó là sự thật ngay cả khi không có bằng chứng

examples: Write your name at the top of the paper.
I wrote a letter to Alison.
I wrote a letter to the Publicity Department.
She wrote a bestselling novel.
To write an article/essay/report.
words.defineEn: to make letters, words, or numbers on a surface, usually a piece of paper, with a pen or pencil
words.defineVi: để viết các chữ cái, từ hoặc số trên một bề mặt, thường là một mảnh giấy, bằng bút hoặc bút chì

examples: His frame spoke tiredness.
He spoke the final words of the play.
The brochure speaks of beautiful secluded grounds.
My mother spoke Russian.
Please speak more slowly.
words.defineEn: to talk to someone about something
words.defineVi: để nói chuyện với ai đó về một cái gì đó

examples: The politician's opponent laughed at his proposal during the debate.
Don't laugh!
My friends all had a good laugh, but at my expense.
To Thomas, her laugh sounded horribly like a growl.
You never laugh at my jokes!
words.defineEn: to make happy sounds and move our face like we are smiling because something is funny
words.defineVi: để tạo ra những âm thanh vui vẻ và di chuyển khuôn mặt của chúng tôi như thể chúng tôi đang cười vì điều gì đó buồn cười

examples: Your car is waiting, sir.
C'm on the crowd is waiting.
We waited there for the better part of an hour.
What are you waiting for?
Leeds United had waited for success for eighteen years.
words.defineEn: to not leave until a person or thing is ready or present or something happens
words.defineVi: để không rời đi cho đến khi một người hoặc điều đã sẵn sàng hoặc hiện tại hoặc một cái gì đó xảy ra

examples: The local bus company only runs a skeleton service on Sundays.
The college runs summer courses for foreign students.
The college also runs evening classes in bricklaying and joinery.
The bookcase runs the length of the room.
The tabloid press ran the story.
words.defineEn: to move using our legs, faster than we usually walk, in a way that both feet are never on the ground at the same time
words.defineVi: di chuyển bằng chân, nhanh hơn chúng ta thường đi bộ, theo cách mà cả hai chân không bao giờ chạm đất cùng một lúc

examples: Rooms begin at $139.
A new era had begun.
The lecture begins at 8pm.
Each chapter begins with a quotation.
We began work on the project in May.
words.defineEn: to do or experience the first part of something
words.defineVi: để làm hoặc trải nghiệm phần đầu tiên của một cái gì đó

examples: My watch has stopped.
The buck stops with him.
The car stopped at the traffic lights.
The team stopped the rot with a 5–0 win last night.
Doctors couldn't stop the bleeding.
words.defineEn: to not move anymore
words.defineVi: không di chuyển nữa

examples: My dad bought a stylish suit for his friend's wedding.
The rich man bought a big house and a fancy car.
We bought a bag of coarse sea salt from the specialty store.
She bought an expensive dress for a special occasion.
I bought a pound of fresh meat from the butcher.
words.defineEn: to get something in exchange for paying money
words.defineVi: để có được một cái gì đó để đổi lấy việc trả tiền

examples: That shot lost him the championship.
lose that creep!
His carelessness lost him the job.
The government has lost control of the city.
The business is losing money.
words.defineEn: to not know the location of a thing or person and be unable to find it
words.defineVi: không biết vị trí của một vật hoặc người và không thể tìm thấy nó

examples: My father pays his bills at the beginning of the month.
Our efforts are finally paying dividends.
Not paying attention.
They both pay their employees badly.
No one paid them any attention.
words.defineEn: to give someone money in exchange for goods or services
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho ai đó tiền để đổi lấy hàng hóa hoặc dịch vụ

examples: Generally, the article reads very well.
My son reads twelve pages of his book every day.
Read my lips.
Read my lips.
Teachers should read more poetry to children.
words.defineEn: to look at written or printed words and understand their meaning
words.defineVi: nhìn vào các từ được viết hoặc in và hiểu ý nghĩa của chúng

examples: That bacon sandwich really hit the spot!
A cup of coffee hits the spot at any given time.
A car hit the barrier.
The bus hit the bridge.
The woman hit the mugger with her umbrella.
words.defineEn: to strike someone or something with force using one's hand or an object
words.defineVi: để tấn công một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó bằng vũ lực bằng tay của một người hoặc một đối tượng

examples: The conference program included a list of session titles along with their corresponding abstracts.
Does the price include tax?
The price includes dinner, bed, and breakfast.
The report includes a number of recommendations.
My favorite smoothie recipe always includes the juiciness of a Jaffa orange.
words.defineEn: to have something as a part of the whole
words.defineVi: để có một cái gì đó như là một phần của toàn bộ

examples: Robins build nests almost anywhere.
The birds built their nest in the tree.
She had built a reputation as a criminal lawyer.
The ironworks were built in 1736.
The houses are built out of local stone.
words.defineEn: to put together different materials such as brick to make a building, etc.
words.defineVi: để tập hợp các vật liệu khác nhau như gạch để tạo nên một tòa nhà, v.v.

examples: The proud uncle held his newborn nephew in his arms.
The medicine cabinet in the bathroom holds our first aid supplies.
Hold your fire!
A strawberry margarita, but hold the tequila.
The senator held the floor for several hours.
words.defineEn: to have in one's hands or arms
words.defineVi: có trong tay hoặc cánh tay của một người

examples: A ramp allows easy access for wheelchairs.
The judge allowed my claim.
Our policy only allows for exchanges.
I allow myself a treat now and then.
The prisoners are allowed out of their cells for two hours a day.
words.defineEn: to let someone or something do a particular thing
words.defineVi: để cho ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó làm một điều cụ thể

examples: The store stays open late on Thursdays.
The TV stays on all day in their house.
Stay in touch with your customers via Internet.
Stay in touch with the latest technologies.
Enjoy your stay at our hotel.
words.defineEn: to not move or leave
words.defineVi: không di chuyển hoặc rời đi

examples: The father and son spent a delightful afternoon playing catch in the park.
Sailors spend the better part of their time at sea.
Reputable charities spend the lion's share of donations on aid and a tiny fraction on administration.
The couple spent their vacation in a cozy cabin, billing and cooing by the fireplace.
We spent hours building structures with construction toys.
words.defineEn: to use money as a payment for services, goods, etc.
words.defineVi: sử dụng tiền như một khoản thanh toán cho các dịch vụ, hàng hóa, v.v.

examples: The farm sits in the shadow of Ben Nevis.
Candidates will sit the examinations in June.
She sits her horse gracefully.
A large bus was sitting outside.
The new policy sits well with the company's values.
words.defineEn: to be in or on a chair or seat, or on the ground, resting our weight on our bottom with a straight back
words.defineVi: ở trong hoặc trên ghế hoặc ghế ngồi, hoặc trên mặt đất, dồn trọng lượng của chúng ta xuống mông với lưng thẳng

examples: Her second movie followed close on the heels of her successful film debut.
Her second movie followed close on the heels of her successful film debut.
The movie follows the book faithfully.
The film faithfully follows Shakespeare's plot.
Millions of people followed the trial on TV.
words.defineEn: to go or come after someone or something; to move or travel behind someone or something
words.defineVi: đi hoặc đến sau ai đó hoặc cái gì đó; để di chuyển hoặc đi phía sau một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: Sales are growing fast.
The market is growing rapidly.
The company is healthily growing its revenue each year.
By degrees their business relationship grew into friendship.
The sector is growing at a phenomenal rate.
words.defineEn: to get larger and taller and become an adult over time
words.defineVi: để lớn hơn và cao hơn và trở thành người lớn theo thời gian

examples: The receptionist led the way to the boardroom.
The department led the world in cancer research.
The company's new product launch led to a fat increase in revenue.
We lead a very quiet life.
To lead a life of luxury/a miserable existence.
words.defineEn: to go in front of or beside someone or something in order to show them the way or to make them go in a particular direction
words.defineVi: đi trước hoặc bên cạnh ai đó hoặc cái gì đó để chỉ đường cho họ hoặc khiến họ đi theo một hướng cụ thể

examples: The party continued into the wee small hours.
The road continues through the village of Knightwick.
The road continues for three miles.
They had to continue their journey on foot.
He continued his work in secret.
words.defineEn: to keep being, happening, or doing something
words.defineVi: để tiếp tục được, xảy ra, hoặc làm một cái gì đó
